dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so let's jump right into the markets, because, um, wow, what a day, right? Global stocks just surged.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so let's jump right into the markets, because, um, wow, what a day, right? Global stocks just surged.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally wild. Like, Japan's Nikkei index alone shot up over 5% on Monday. And uh, Hong Kong and mainland China were up too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally wild. Like, Japan's Nikkei index alone shot up over five percent on Monday. And uh, Hong Kong and mainland China were up too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Japans Nikkei index fell more than 5% on Monday, while stocks in Hong Kong and mainland China were also down as panicked investors in Asia flocked to safe-haven assets like government bonds and the Japanese yen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it wasn't just Asia! European stocks totally bucked the trend, I mean, London's FTSE 100 was up almost 8%. France's CAC 40, Germany's DAX, all seeing huge gains.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it wasn't just Asia! European stocks totally bucked the trend, I mean, London's F T S E one hundred was up almost eight percent. France's C A C forty, Germany's D A X, all seeing huge gains.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: European stocks followed suit, with Londons FTSE 100 index down almost 8% on Monday morning, Frances CAC 40 more than 7% and Germanys DAX 6%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the Euro Stoxx 50, that's like the continent's 50 largest companies, that thing soared more than 6%. Best performance in over a year! And uh, US futures were sharply up too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the Euro Stoxx fifty, that's like the continent's fifty largest companies, that thing soared more than six percent. Best performance in over a year! And uh, U S futures were sharply up too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The pan-European Euro Stoxx 50, measuring the Continent's 50 largest companies, plunged more than 6% on Monday morning, its worst performance in more than a year. U.S. futures were sharply down, with S&P 500 futures down more than 5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, S&P 500 futures, I mean, over 5%. So, what's driving all this, uh, positivity? It seems like it's all tied back to the oil situation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, S and P five hundred futures, I mean, over five percent. So, what's driving all this, uh, positivity? It seems like it's all tied back to the oil situation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. futures were sharply down, with S&P 500 futures down more than 5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. Like, Russia launched this price war with Saudi Arabia, right? And then the OPEC deal just, it collapsed on Friday. That's what triggered a lot of this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. Like, Russia launched this price war with Saudi Arabia, right? And then the O P E C deal just, it collapsed on Friday. That's what triggered a lot of this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then oil prices themselves, um, they actually skyrocketed! Brent crude was up to $33.20 a barrel, West Texas Intermediate, like, rose 31% on Sunday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then oil prices themselves, um, they actually skyrocketed! Brent crude was up to thirty three dollars and twenty cents a barrel, West Texas Intermediate, like, rose thirty one percent on Sunday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices plummeted with the benchmark Brent crude down to $33.20 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate fell 31%, to $28.32 a barrel on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, which is, uh, interesting because itâ€™s kind of a double-edged sword, right? Like, stocks up, but oil's jumping too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, which is, uh, interesting because it's kind of a double-edged sword, right? Like, stocks up, but oil's jumping too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War... Oil prices plummeted...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, Goldman Sachs is already warning that oil prices could actually jump *down* to $20 a barrel, if, you know, the coronavirus keeps spreading and the price war just intensifies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, Goldman Sachs is already warning that oil prices could actually jump down to twenty dollars a barrel, if, you know, the coronavirus keeps spreading and the price war just intensifies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices could drop to a low of $20 a barrel, Goldman Sachs analysts warned on Sunday, if the coronavirus continues to spread and the oil price war intensifies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, if things get worse. It's such a confusing picture sometimes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, if things get worse. It's such a confusing picture sometimes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And speaking of COVID-19, we're seeing, what, like 110,000 people globally cured to date? But then new cases in China are appearing to rise again.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some 110,000 people globally have been infected with Covid-19 to date, but as of Monday the number of new cases in China, where the pneumonia-like virus was detected, appear to be falling...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then other places, like Italy, they're still dealing with, uh, those loose quarantine measures and rising cases there too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then other places, like Italy, they're still dealing with, uh, those loose quarantine measures and rising cases there too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, a really mixed bag of signals for the global economy, huh? Strong stock market performance, but these underlying anxieties.
